text: Yes, but I am trying to sidestep STRidge entirely. By passing an appropriately sparse prior (say spike & slab), most of the neural network parameters should be close to zero. By removing those connections from the network, I think the term might be recovered also, and then you have completely Bayesian model selection (which is important for me working on Bayesian experimental design).
